feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model
feed.subtitle: SAP Cloud Application Programming Model Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP CAP : 502 "Error during request to remote service: read ECONNRESET"
entry.content:
Hi,

I am developing SAP CAP application, node.js, trying to connect to external S4 onPrem service which is accessed via the cloud connector.

I am trying to reach S4 OData service from CAP Application locally in Business Application Studio via SAP Cloud Connector.

To connect to the destination and other services we are using the “cds bind -2” command, which created the .cdsrc-private.json file.

I am able to connect to the different BTP instances like the destination, authorization and connectivity instances, when i run the app using 

cds watch --profile hybrid

But when i'm trying to access any of the entities within the S4 OData service facing the following error,

{"error":{"code":"502","message":"Error during request to remote service: read ECONNRESET"}}

Has anyone faced this issue, please suggest an appropriate solution for this.

Also when the applicaiton is deployed to BTP,  the S4 odata services are accessiable via destination and the application is working as expected,

i want run the application locally for development phase, hence need your help,

Regards,

Aakash

entry.title: CAP: "cds deploy --to hana --no-build" no longer works with @sap/cds-dk 9.0.6
entry.content:
Hello experts,

cds deploy --to hana --no-build

 is no longer working with  @SAP/cds-dk 9.0.6.

Error message:

One or more options are not supported by cds deploy to hana: --no-build

With @SAP/cds-dk  8.6.1 it is working.

Output of cds deploy --help for both versions:

SYNOPSIS

cds deploy [ <model> ] [ <options> ]

--no-build (only in combination with --to hana)

 EXAMPLES
cds deploy --to sqlite:db
cds deploy --to hana
cds deploy --to hana:myService --auto-undeploy
cds deploy --to hana --no-build

entry.title: How to bind to an existing service without knowing its name (Cloud Foundry / SAP BTP)?
entry.content:
I’m deploying an app to multiple subaccounts in SAP BTP (Cloud Foundry), and I need to bind to an existing aicore service instance.The issue is that each subaccount already has an aicore service, but with different names (e.g. my-aicore, aicore-prod, etc).

If I use this in mta.yaml:
It creates a new service, which I want to avoid.

  - name: generative-ai-hub
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service-plan: extended
      service: aicore

If I try this:
It gives an error because there’s no service named generative-ai-hub in the subaccount.

  - name: generative-ai-hub
    type: org.cloudfoundry.existing-service
    parameters:
      service-plan: extended
      service: aicore

Is there a way to bind to an existing service without knowing its exact name?
Or maybe some way to reference it dynamically?

entry.title: SFE annotations for dependent filtering on an Action Button's parameters do not work with array type
entry.content:
Greetings, community experts.

The title of my post basically explains the entire problem I'm having: I have a SAP Fiori Elements app that places an Action button that requires three parameters, among which there must be dependent filters. The specific annotation is as follows:

	actions
	{
		@(
			cds.odata.bindingparameter.name : '_it',
			Common.SideEffects :
			{
				TargetEntities : ['_it']
			},
			Core.OperationAvailable : _it.IsActiveEntity //avoids execution in Draft Mode
		)
		action addSItems(
			p_lob: String(30)
				@title : '{i18n>_LOBS}' 
				@Common.ValueList:
				{
					CollectionPath : 'LoBs',
					Label : '{i18n>_LOBS}',
					SearchSupported : true,
					Parameters : 
					[
						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterOut',
							LocalDataProperty: p_lob,
							ValueListProperty: 'code',
						}
					],
				}
				@Common.ValueListWithFixedValues,

			p_barea: String(30)
				@title : '{i18n>_BUSAREA}'
				@Common.ValueList:
				{
					CollectionPath : 'BusinessAreas',
					Label : '{i18n>_BUSAREA}',
					SearchSupported : true,
					Parameters : 
					[
						// filtrar la bus. areas por la LoB seleccionada
						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterFilterOnly',
							ValueListProperty: 'lob_code',
						},
						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterIn',
							ValueListProperty: 'lob_code',
							LocalDataProperty: p_lob
						},
						///

						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterOut',
							LocalDataProperty: p_barea,
							ValueListProperty: 'code',
						},
					],
				}
				@Common.ValueListWithFixedValues,

			p_sitem: (30)
				@title: '{i18n>_SITEM}'
				@Common.ValueList:
				{
					CollectionPath : 'AUX_SItems',
					Label : '{i18n>_SITEM}',
					SearchSupported : true,
					Parameters : 
					[
						// filtrar por scope items no presentes aun en el mapa,
						// y por LoBs y Bus. Areas seleccionadas
						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterFilterOnly',
							ValueListProperty: 'bMap_iid'
						},
						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterFilterOnly',
							ValueListProperty: 'lob_code',
						},
						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterFilterOnly',
							ValueListProperty: 'bArea_code',
						},
						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterIn',
							LocalDataProperty: '_it/iid',
							ValueListProperty: 'bMap_iid'
						},
						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterIn',
							LocalDataProperty: p_lob,
							ValueListProperty: 'lob_code'
						},
						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterIn',
							LocalDataProperty: p_barea ,
							ValueListProperty: 'bArea_code'
						},
						//////

						{
							$Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterOut',
							LocalDataProperty: p_sitem,
							ValueListProperty: 'code',
						}
					],
				}
		);
	};

Now, the problem is that when the data type of the parameters p_lob, p_barea, and p_sitem changes to  array of String (because I need a multi-valued select box), the dependent filtering no longer works. I have no clue why this happens.

Any help and/or comments that shed light on this are welcome.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: "cds add workzone" relativePaths: true is missing in ui5-deploy.yaml
entry.content:
Hi CAP team,

I have created a simple CAP project with a Fiori elements UI using the commands below:

cds init <projectname>
cds add tiny-sample
cds add xsuaa,hana --for production
cds add mta
<add UI>
cds add workzone
cds up

When I open the deployed app from HTML5 Applications menu, the app fails to fetch the metadata. The reason is that the uri of the service starts with a leading slash. In the Cloud Foundry environment, this should be removed.

    "dataSources": {
      "mainService": {
        "uri": "/odata/v4/catalog/",
        "type": "OData",
        "settings": {
          "annotations": [],
          "odataVersion": "4.0"
        }
      }
    }

If I create a standalone UI application, the `ui5-task-zipper` task in ui5-deploy.yaml is as follows:

    - name: ui5-task-zipper
      afterTask: generateVersionInfo
      configuration:
        archiveName: books-ui
        relativePaths: true
        additionalFiles:
          - xs-app.json

Whereas the same task with `cds add workzone` is missing the `relativePaths: true` :

    - name: ui5-task-zipper
      afterTask: generateVersionInfo
      configuration:
        archiveName: books-ui
        additionalFiles:
          - xs-app.json

With `relativePaths: true`, the leading slash is removed when the zip file is created. Therefore, I think this needs to be added when creating the ui5-deploy.yaml file by `cds add workzone`.

The output of `cds -v`

@cap-js/asyncapi: 1.0.3
@cap-js/openapi: 1.2.3
@sap/cds: 9.1.0
@sap/cds-compiler: 6.1.0
@sap/cds-dk (global): 9.1.0
@sap/cds-fiori: 2.0.1
@sap/cds-mtxs: 3.1.0
Node.js: v20.13.1
cap-ui-deploy-test: 1.0.0

entry.title: Multi-tenant CAP app with Fiori
entry.content:
Hi,

I am trying to explore the simplest multi-tenant CAP app using the samples. It has the bookshop backend and two frontend apps named browse and admin.

I have deployed the multi tenant app and can subscribe and view data accessing the backend API. But I am not able to access the Fiori Apps. It gives me the error saying 'File not found'.

The easiest way to replicate the same is using the template wizard for CAP.

Now, the app is deployed and subscribed from other subaccount. The service endpoint is accessible:

But the Fiori endpoint throws error:

What could be the issue here? Any help is highly appreciated.

entry.title: Unsupported media type 415 error when using cap-js/attachment via HTTP POST
entry.content:
I'm trying to upload an attachment via HTTP POST OData call to my CAP service entity that has an extended Attachments field/association from cap-js/attachments via a React external app, but I'm encountering a 415 HTTP error code. I can successfully create an entry to my main entity, but I'm unable to create an attachment due to the 415 error. Has anyone encountered this?

So far the terminal logs isn't showing any error, only in the browser.

entry.title: How to subscribe multi-tenant app in different global account.
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We have a multitenant application hosted on SAP BTP which uses resources such as destination service and cloud connector. This works fine when our customers' subscribing subaccounts reside in the same global account that also keeps the subaccount that provides the application. I know this should be the preferred way to realize multitenant subscriptions. However, some customers would like to subscribe the app from within their own global account, i.e. a subaccount should subscribe to another subaccount in a different global account.

As described in this article service broker could be an option to do this but it comes with disadvantages (cloud connector/destinations cannot be used).

Is there another standard approach to subscribe to a multitenant app/subaccount in a different global account?

 

Many Thanks,

RK

entry.title: Local Mocking of External Service not working
entry.content:
I'm following the official documentation (https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/using-services) to integrate an external OData Service (API_BUSINESS_PARTER) while trying to mock it for local development. The steps I've taken:

  1. Download the edmx file from the Business Accelerator Hub
  2. import via "cds import <input_file> --as cds"
  3. Create srv/external/data/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER-A_BusinessPartner.csv and populate with example data from the docs
  4. Run the following code:
const bupa = await cds.connect.to('API_BUSINESS_PARTNER');
const { A_BusinessPartner } = bupa.entities;
const result = await bupa.run(SELECT(A_BusinessPartner).limit(100));

 In the logs I can see the following output for cds-ts watch

[cds] - mocking API_BUSINESS_PARTNER {
  impl: '../node_modules/@sap/cds/libx/_runtime/common/Service.js',
  path: '/odata/v4/api-business-partner'
}

However, when the code above runs I'm getting the following error:

[error] - 500 > {
  code: '500',
  message: 'no such table: API_BUSINESS_PARTNER_A_BusinessPartner in:\n' +
    `SELECT json_insert(jsonb_insert('{}','$."BusinessPartner"',BusinessPartner,'$."Customer"'

 I would have expected the server to return the mock data from the csv file, but I can't get it to work. Anything I'm missing here that's not in the official documentation? I also ran "cds deploy --to sqlite" but it's not creating the table in question...

project dependencies:

"@sap/cds": "8.7.2",
"@sap/cds-dk": "8.9.4",
"@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity": "4.0.2",
"@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client": "4.0.2",
"@sap-cloud-sdk/resilience": "4.0.2",
"@cap-js/cds-typer": "0.35.0",
"@cap-js/cds-types": "0.10.0",
"@cap-js/sqlite": "1.11.1",
"@sap/cds-dk": "8.9.4",
"@sap/cds-lsp": "8.9.1",

entry.title: Problems creating a multitenancy app with CAP
entry.content:
Hello,

we want to create a multitenancy CAP app with Approuter and standalone HTML5 apps (html5-repo), but without portal or workzone. An example is linked (https://github.com/christopher-ketzler/book). The deployment (mta) of the app and the creation of the route works fine. Unfortunately, an “Internal Server Error” occurs when the app is called up. The app is not able to authenticate againt the subscriber subaccount. I have no clue why this happens as I changed the tenant-mode to "shared" (see below).

The app was created in the similar as described in the Cap documentation. It was developed on the BAS and deployed on a BTP trial. The xs-security.json has been extended to support multitenancy and the trial account:

"tenant-mode":"shared",

"oauth2-configuration": {

  "redirect-uris": ["https://*.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com/**"]

}

The Approuter (xs-app.json) has been extended to include the link to the Fiori Elements app:

"welcomeFile": "bookui",

I have noticed that the uua tenantmode configuration listed in the HTML5 Runtime does not change to “shared” after updating the tenant. Why is this the case?

The project was created as follows:

  • cds init book –add tiny-sample
  • Creation of the Fiori Elements App (Wizzard).
  • cds add hana,xsuaa,approuter,html5-repo
  • cds add multitenancy
  • cds add mta
  • npm i (also within the mtx modul)
  • Adjustments see below.
  • mbt build
  • cf deploy mta_archive/… -f
  • Creation oft he route in the BTP Cockpit.
  • Update the tenant in the “SaaS Provisioning Service“

Regards

Christopher

entry.title: SAP CAP - Advanced Event Mesh Different Subaccounts
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We want to implement a CAP services to send and receive events to and from Advanced Event Mesh. We have followed the configuration as follows:

https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-integration-suite/advanced-event-mesh/cap-plugin-for-sap-integration-suite-advanced-event-mesh

In our landscape, our CAP service is an a different subaccount than our Advanced Event Mesh and I am wondering if this may be an issue due to the below statement:

The handshake API end point. As a prerequisite, you created a SAP Integration Suite, aem-validation-service-plan instance, and then created a service binding to this instance. After service binding, the details for the handshake API end point are available in the URI field. Copy these details and use them for creating the user provided variables.

It seems that our CAP service needs to be bound to an instance of SAP Integration Suite, aem-validation-service-plan instance but this instance will exist in the Advanced Event Mesh subaccount, hence the binding is not possible.

Any idea if this set up can work with the CAP service in a different subaccount as Advanced Event Mesh?

Thanks in advance.

Regards,

C.

entry.title: CDS not found - SAP CAPM deployment failing resulting in server crash
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

You kindly helped Syed to resolve this issue https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/sap-cap-multi-tenant-app-deployment-failing-cds-not-found/qaq-p/13751344. Apologies for creating a new ticket as I dont know how to continue discussion on same ticket. Again apologies.

Similar to Syed, I am also trying to deploy SAP CAP Multi-tenant application, while deploying the app my app got crashed with error as ERR sh:1:cds:not found and some other errors. I have attached server error, package.json and mta.yaml file.

PS: I have added "start": "cds-serve" and "@sap/cds-dk": "^9" in my package.json and ran npm i -g @sap/cds-dk & npm install -g npm@11.4.2 from SAP BAS tool using terminal under folder /home/user/projects/vivekcapm

@Willem_Pardaens can you please guide me ?

Regards,
Vivek

entry.title: SAP CAP MTA - Dynamic Property Value
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We have a CAP application and we want to inject dynamically the value of one of the properties in the MTA file depending on the environment. This info could be stored as a environment variable bound to the app or even in a user provided service.

Can this be achieved at all?

Not able to find any clear guidance on this.

Thanks,

C.

entry.title: CDS watch fails in Business application studio.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am using BAS to create a CAPM application on Node.js. However, when I perform "cds watch", it gives following error. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
ERROR: Package '@sap/cds' was loaded from different installations: [
  '/home/user/projects/sample_app/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/index.js',
  '/extbin/globals/pnpm/5/.pnpm/@sap+cds@9.1.0_@eslint+js@9.30.1_express@4.21.2/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/index.js'
] 
Ensure a single install to avoid hard-to-resolve errors.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

My package.json looks as follows

{
  "name": "Sample_App",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A simple CAP project.",
  "repository": "<Add your repository here>",
  "license": "UNLICENSED",
  "private": true,
  "devDependencies": {
    "@sap/ux-specification": "^1.120.8",
    "rimraf": "^5"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "cds-serve",
    "watch-reassure": "cds watch --open uimodule/webapp/index.html?sap-ui-xx-viewCache=false",
    "undeploy": "cf undeploy Sample_App --delete-services --delete-service-keys --delete-service-brokers",
    "build": "rimraf resources mta_archives && mbt build --mtar archive",
    "deploy": "cf deploy mta_archives/archive.mtar --retries 1"
  },
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "db": {
        "kind": "hana"
      },
      "uaa": {
        "kind": "xsuaa"
      },
      "[production]": {
        "db": {
          "kind": "hana-cloud"
        },
        "auth": {
          "kind": "xsuaa"
        },
        "approuter": {
          "kind": "cloudfoundry"
        }
      },
      "auth": {
        "kind": "xsuaa"
      }
    },
    "cov2ap": {
      "plugin": true,
      "path": "v2"
    },
    "hana": {
      "deploy-format": "hdbtable"
    }
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@cap-js-community/odata-v2-adapter": "^1.15.2",
    "@cap-js/hana": "^2",
    "@sap/cds": "^9",
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^9",
    "@sap/xssec": "^4",
    "express": "^4",
    "jwt-decode": "^4",
    "sap-cf-axios": "^1.0.2"
  }
}

 

cds -v gives

-js/asyncapi: 1.0.3
@cap-js/db-service: 2.2.0
@cap-js/hana: 2.1.1
@cap-js/openapi: 1.2.3
@sap/cds: 9.1.0
@sap/cds-compiler: 6.1.0
@sap/cds-dk: 9.1.1
@sap/cds-dk (global): 9.0.6
@sap/cds-fiori: 2.0.1
@sap/cds-mtxs: 3.1.0
Sample_App: 1.0.0
Node.js: v22.13.1

 

npm ls -g gives

/home/user/.node_modules_global/lib
└── (empty)

 

Have tried installing @SAP/cds@9.0.6 to no avail. Kindly guide.

 

Regards,

Akshay

SAP Business Application Studio SAP Cloud Application Programming Model Node.js

entry.title: SAP CAP Service with Managed Router
entry.content:
Hi experts,

Since the begining of the days with CAP, we have always used standalone app router and we are wondering if we should be using a managed app router instead as we are doing with most of our UI5 apps.

The app router documentation for UI5 apps is quite well documented but no so clear when it comes to SAP CAP.

What is it required for a CAP service to use a managed app router?

If we do not include an app router in our MTA, is our service by default going to use a managed app router? If so, is there any kind of pre-requisite (subaccount needs to have SAP WZ, SAP CAP should include presentation layer)?

Many thanks in advance.

Regards,

C.

entry.title: Entity Creation from Fiori Elements Extension
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'm currently experiencing an issue while upgrading an app from CAP v7 to CAP v8, hoping I can get some advice. This application has a parent and child entity (a 1 to many composition), like below:

entity Deliveries: managed, cuid {
  deliveryField1: String(10);
  deliveryField2: String(10);
  pallets: Composition of many Pallets on pallets.delivery = $self;
}

entity Pallets: managed, cuid {
  palletField1: String(10);
  palletField2: String(10);
  delivery: Association to one Deliveries;
}

The service definition is straightforward:

.draft.enabled
entity Deliveries as projection on db.Deliveries;

@cds.redirection.target
entity Pallets as projection on db.Pallets;

The UI of this is a custom Fiori elements table where for example you can assign multiple pallets to a delivery at once. In the custom UI5 logic, once the relevant items are chosen, they are created in the CAP backend like this:

const oPalletTable = this.getView().byId("fe::CustomSubSection::Pallets--PalletTable");
const oBinding = oPalletTable.getBinding("items");
const pallet = oBinding.create({
  palletField1: 'val1',
  palletField2: 'val2',
});
await pallet.created();

Which initiates a post OData call to /Deliveries(ID=xxx,IsActiveEntity=false)/pallets

This setup worked fine in CAP v7. After upgrading to CAP v8 however, the create call still initiates but the fields (e.g. palletField1 and palletField2 in this example) are being stripped out by the CAP backend and a blank entity is being created (the generated IDs and draft administrative data is present, but the field values passed from the frontend are blank).

I say the fields are being stripped out by the backend because when I debug the service handler (this.on("CREATE", Pallets.drafts, async (req, next) => {), in req.data the fields are blank, however if I look at req.http.req.body this shows the raw HTTP request and the fields are populated. So the field values are making it to the CAP backend, however they do not make it into req.data.

Any advice or guidance would be appreciated. I'm not sure whether this is the correct way to create entities programmatically from UI5 however it did work for CAP v7 or if it something related to the entity or service definition.

Regards,
Tim

Link- GitRepositoryQuestion

Regards,

Ganesh N

entry.title: HDI access on Database explorer for CAP services
entry.content:
Hi experts,

Developers used to access HDI containers part of CAP services over Database Explorer. For this, they only thing required is to grant the Cloud Foundry Developer role developers in the space where the HDI is deployed. 

Now, we do not want to grant the Cloud Foundry Developer role to developers but we still would like to grant access to developers to the HDI over the Database explorer. How can we achieve this?

Note that we may not want to grant write permission to developers so we may not want to assign directly the HDI:access:role to users.

Many thanks!

C.

entry.title: Issues with SAP Business Hub REST API consumption in CAP App
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have a scenario, where I need to fetch all data from OMF Product API which is available in SAP Business Acclerator Hub as a REST service.

Overview | Products | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

When I import the JSON/YAML service as directed in all CAP guides, it is imported. But there is no entity definition.

My objective is to fetch all the records with $top and $skip and show it in a simple CAP List View app without storing it in persistence storage (Like HANA Cloud). 

Can you provide a guide or help on how I can achieve it? I have done it through the REST Proxy method but it is failing to get a large set of data and getting timeout.

DB Schema

entity Product {
  key id                          : UUID;
      displayId                   : String;
      externalSystemReferences    : String;
      name                        : String;
      productType                 : String;
      description                 : String;
      published                   : Boolean;
      replicationType             : String;
      soldElectronically          : Boolean;
      markedForDeletion           : Boolean;
      activeMarketIds             : String;
      aspectId                    : String;
      baseUnitOfMeasure           : String;
      physicalProductCategory     : String;
      physicalProductGroup        : String;
      physicalProductItemCategory : String;
      physicalProductType         : String;
      salesAreaData               : String;
      unitOfMeasures              : String;
}

 SERVICE.JS

const { default: cds } = require("@sap/cds");

module.exports = cds.service.impl(async function () {
    const {
        Product
    } = this.entities;
    var firstRead = true;
    this.before('READ', Product, async (req) => {
        try {
            if (firstRead) {
                var recfound = 0;
                var pageNumber = 0; 
                var pageSize = req.query.SELECT.limit.rows.val;
                do {
                    const sapOmf = await cds.connect.to('sapOmfProductApi');
                    const resp = await sapOmf.get('/product-management/v1/products?pageNumber=' + pageNumber); // + "&pageSize=" + pageSize);
                    const products = resp;
                    const entries = [];
                    //products.forEach(product => {
                    for (const product of products) {
                        const extSystem = product.externalSystemReferences;
                        let extSysText = '';
                        if (extSystem) {
                            extSystem.forEach(es => {
                                extSysText += es.externalId + '-' + es.externalSystemId + ",";
                            });
                        }

                        const prodDetail = await sapOmf.get('/product-management/v1/products/' + product.id);
                        const amkid = prodDetail.activeMarketIds;
                        const salesArea = prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.salesAreaData;
                        const uom = prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.unitOfMeasures;
                        let mktext = '';
                        if (amkid) {
                            amkid.forEach(mk => {
                                mktext += mk + '-';
                            });
                        }
                        let satext = '';
                        if (salesArea) {
                            salesArea.forEach(area => {
                                satext += 'Active:' + area.active + '-' + 'Distribution Channel:' + area.distributionChannel + '-' +
                                    'Division:' + area.division + '-' + 'Pricing Ref Product:' + area.pricingReferenceProduct + '-' +
                                    'Product Pricing Group:' + area.productPricingGroup + '-' + 'Sales Org:' + area.salesOrganization + ',';
                            });
                        }

                        let uomtext = '';
                        if (uom) {
                            uom.forEach(um => {
                                uomtext += um.alternativeUnitOfMeasure + '-' + um.numerator + '-' + um.denominator + ',';
                            });
                        }
                        entries.push({
                            id: product.id,
                            displayId: product.displayId,
                            externalSystemReferences: extSysText,
                            name: product.name,
                            productType: product.productType,
                            description: product.description,
                            published: product.published,
                            replicationType: product.replicationType,
                            soldElectronically: product.soldElectronically,
                            markedForDeletion: product.markedForDeletion,
                            activeMarketIds: mktext,
                            salesAreaData: satext,
                            unitOfMeasures: uomtext,
                            aspectId: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.aspectId,
                            baseUnitOfMeasure: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.baseUnitOfMeasure,
                            physicalProductType: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductType,
                            physicalProductItemCategory: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductItemCategory,
                            physicalProductCategory: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductCategory,
                            physicalProductGroup: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductGroup
                        });
                    }
                    // delete all countries

                    await cds.tx(req).run(INSERT.into(Product).entries(entries));
                    firstRead = false;
                    pageNumber++;
                    recfound = entries.length;

                } while (recfound > 0);
                return req;
            }
        } catch (err) {
            req.error(500, err.message);
        }
    });
});

This is using a schema and trying to insert data in that DB table every time. I am sure this not the best method and for large set of data it is not working. Please let me know the best way and how I can fetch data in bunch like 30 records at a time.
